4_Service Providers must implement effective measures to prevent minor users from becoming addicted to such services_PR.AT-01_PR.DS-01_GV.PO-01__High_

4_Service Providers who offer "deep synthesis" (or "deep fake") services must label any visuals or videos to alert the public about their non-human authored nature. Service Providers must also ensure that their service is safe
4_Service Providers must immediately suspend and terminate the generation or transmission of any illegal content and services. In addition
column2: if any users are found to be using the services for illegal activities
column3: Service Providers must take actions to suspend services
column4: issue warnings and report the case to relevant authorities_RS.MI-01; RS.MI-02_DE.CM-03_RS.CO-02__High_

column1: 4_(a) Uphold the core socialist values and not generate content that may harm national security or that is forbidden by laws or regulations_GV.OC-03_GV.PO-01___High_
4_(b) Adopt effective measures to prevent the content from discriminating on any basis_GV.RR-01_PR.AT-01___High_
4_(c) Respect Intellectual Property rights and commercial ethics_GV.OC-03_GV.RR-01___High_
4_(d) Respect the lawful rights of others
column2: and not infringe on their well-being and interests_GV.OC-03_GV.RR-01___High_

column1: 4_(e) Undertake strict and effective measures to increase the transparency
5_Pre-training and optimization training. Service Providers must only use data that has been "legally acquired" for model training_PR.DS-01_GV.OC-03__data protection_High_
5_Personal information collection. Service Providers must not collect unnecessary personal information
column2: store input information or usage records in a way that can identify the personal details of users
column3: or provide such information or records to third parties_PR.DS-01; PR.DS-02_PR.AA-05_GV.OC-03_privacy; data protection_High_

column1: 5_Compliant channels. Service Providers must establish a mechanism for receiving and handling user complaints. In addition
column2: they must also respond to any user's request for reviewing
column5: supplementing and deleting their personal information in a timely manner_GV.RR-02_PR.AT-01_RS.CO-02_privacy_High_

column1: 5_Security assessment and algorithm filing of certain services. If any service possesses public opinion attributes or have capacity for "social mobilisation"
column2: the Service Provider must conduct a security assessment
column3: and comply with the filing/alteration/cancellation-related requirements set out in the Algorithm Measures_ID.RA-05_GV.SC-01_GV.OC-03__High_

column1: 5_The security assessment can be conducted either by the Service Provider or through a third party
column2: and must be filed with the local branches of the CAC and China's Public Security Bureau. Such filing of an algorithm must be completed within ten working days of providing relevant services_ID.RA-05_GV.SC-02___High_

column1: 6_Service Agreement and identity information. A service agreement must be executed between the Service Provider and the users who register for its services_GV.SC-05_PR.AA-01___High_
6_If any service possesses public opinion attributes or have capacity for "social mobilisation"

column1: 6_Article 19 requires Service Providers to provide information on the training data's sources
column4: tagging rules and algorithm mechanisms to relevant government departments_GV.SC-02_PR.DS-01__transparency_High_

column1: 7_The Interim Measures relax some of the requirements set out in the Draft Measures
column2: reflecting the China government's intention to encourage development of generative AI service – while at the same time setting out obligations regarding content management
column3: protection and security of personal data
column4: and transparency of generative AI within China_GV.OC-03_GV.PO-02__privacy; transparency_Medium_

column1: 1_With its promises of greater efficiencies and transformational capabilities
column2: comes risks relating to data privacy
column5: and lack of transparency on how decisions affecting people's livelihoos are being made_ID.RA-03_GV.RM-06__privacy; transparency_Medium_

column1: 2_Different jurisdictions are diverging in how they regulate AI – with varying views regarding the level of risk that AI poses
column2: what needs to be regulated and restricted
column3: and the role of government regulations versus voluntary commitments_GV.OC-03_GV.RM-02___Medium_

column1: 2_China has been particularly proactive (by global standards) in developing a regulatory framework of AI – with the aim of balancing fostering innovation versus maintaining control of the technology sector_GV.OC-03_GV.PO-01___Medium_
3_The Interim Measures regulate the provision of generative AI services in China and have been substantially amended from the Draft Measures to be more commercial
column3: as well as recognising possible foreign investment in developing and providing generative AI services in China_GV.OC-03_GV.PO-02___Medium_

column1: 4_Generative AI Service Provider refers to an entity or individual that uses generative AI technologies to provide Generative AI Services
column2: including providers of the underlying generative AI technologies and any person who provides applications on top of such technologies via APIs_GV.OC-02____Low_definition

column1: 4_Generative AI Service User refers to an entity or individual that uses contents generated from the Generative AI Services_GV.OC-02____Low_definition

5_The Draft Measures included a requirement to take measures within three months through model optimization training to prevent illegal content from being generated again – this has been removed from the Interim Measures_GV.PO-02_GV.RM-04___Medium_
6_The security assessment can be conducted either by the Service Provider or through a third party
column2: and must be filed with the local branches of the CAC and China's Public Security Bureau_ID.RA-05_GV.SC-02___High_

column1: 7_There are still some questions to be answered. Notably
column2: the Interim Measures also state that there may be further classified and graded regulations applicable to generative AI services_GV.OC-03____Low_

column1: 7_Some of the aspects within the Interim Measures will likely be developed – such as copyright status/protection of any materials arising from generative AI
column2: how and the extent to which algorithms are to be disclosed
column3: and how phrases such as "support the public opinion or mobilize the public" will be interpreted_GV.PO-02_GV.OC-03__transparency_Medium_

column1: 7_The Interim Measures also represent a new addition to China's regulatory framework for data_GV.OC-03____Low_
